intro: Eremothera minor, commonly known as the lesser eremothera, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations such as small, hairy leaves to reduce water loss. Its flowers are usually yellow or white, and it produces small, wind-dispersed seeds. Eremothera minor is often found in rocky soils and is considered a drought-tolerant species.
